conversation.content: [confused] Pills? What do you mean pills? [pause] The school called and said— [gasp] Oh my God. The Adderall. [shaky voice] They're saying Jordan's been selling the Adderall to other kids for months? [long pause] Months. This has been going on for months and I didn't... [sigh] How did I not see this? [angry] I mean, I've been refilling those prescriptions every single month, thinking they're helping with the ADHD, and instead— [frustrated] God, I'm such an idiot. [pause] Wait, so all those times Jordan said the medication wasn't working well, was that just to, um... to get the dosage increased? [upset] Jesus Christ. [short pause] And the money for those new headphones, the... the concert tickets. [bitter] "I've been saving up from babysitting." [furious] Babysitting! There was no babysitting! [crying while speaking] What else have I been blind to? Hmm. I keep thinking about all the signs I must have missed. [anxious] What if the other parents press charges? What if colleges find out? [shaky voice] Oh God, what if someone got hurt taking medication that wasn't prescribed to them? [exhausted] I don't even know where to start with this. Do I call a lawyer first or... or a therapist or— [sigh] I have no idea what I'm supposed to do here.
